Package com.btmatthews.utils.monitor

Class Monitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.btmatthews.utils.monitor.Monitor
  • public final class Monitor
extends Object
    The monitor object is used to control a server.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Brian Matthews

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static Pattern CONFIGURE_PATTERN
      The regex for the configure command.
      private static int DEFAULT_RETRY_COUNT
      The default number of times to retry when checking for successful server start or stop.
      private static int DEFAULT_RETRY_INTERVAL
      The default interval between retries when checking for successful server start or stop.
      private String monitorKey
      The monitor key that must prefix any commands.
      private int monitorPort
      The port on which the monitor is listening.
      private int retryCount
      The number of times to retry when checking for successful server start or stop.
      private int retryInterval
      The interval between retries when checking for successful server start or stop.
      private static String STOP
      The stop command.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private ServerSocket bindMonitor()
      Bind to the monitor first attempting to use InetAddress.getLocalHost() then falling back to using the loopback address if there is a security exception.
      private Socket connectMonitor()
      Connect to the monitor first attempting to use InetAddress.getLocalHost() then falling back to using the loopback address if there is a security exception.
      private boolean executeCommand​(Server server, String command, Logger logger)
      Execute a command that was sent to the monitor.
      private String getCommand​(Socket clientSocket, Logger logger)
      Read the key and command combination from the client socket connection.
      void runMonitor​(Server server, Logger logger, MonitorObserver observer)
      Run the monitor listening for commands and sending them to the server.
      Thread runMonitorDaemon​(Server server, Logger logger, MonitorObserver observer)
      Spawn a thread used to run the monitor as daemon processes.
      private void runMonitorInternal​(Server server, Logger logger, ServerSocket serverSocket)
      Run the monitor listening for commands at serverSocket and sending them to the server.
      static void sendCommand​(String key, int port, String command, Logger logger)
      Static method used to send a command to a server via a monitor.
      void sendCommand​(String command, Logger logger)
      Send a command to the monitor.
      private boolean waitForStart​(Server server, Logger logger)
      Wait for the server to start.
      private boolean waitForStop​(Server server, Logger logger)
      Wait for the server to stop.

      • Monitor

        public Monitor​(String key,
               int port,
               int count,
               int interval)
        The constructor that initialises the monitor key and port.
        Parameters:
        key - The monitor key that must prefix any commands.
        port - The port on which the monitor is listening.
        count - The number of retry counts.
        interval - The intervals between retries.

    • Method Detail

      • sendCommand

        public static void sendCommand​(String key,
                               int port,
                               String command,
                               Logger logger)
        Static method used to send a command to a server via a monitor.
        Parameters:
        key - The monitor key.
        port - The monitor port.
        command - The command to be sent to the server.
        logger - Used to log information and error messages.

      • runMonitor

        public void runMonitor​(Server server,
                       Logger logger,
                       MonitorObserver observer)
        Run the monitor listening for commands and sending them to the server.
        Parameters:
        server - The server being monitored.
        logger - Used to log error messages.
        observer - Used to handle notifications for server start and stop.

      • runMonitorDaemon

        public Thread runMonitorDaemon​(Server server,
                               Logger logger,
                               MonitorObserver observer)
        Spawn a thread used to run the monitor as daemon processes.
        Parameters:
        server - The server.
        logger - Used to log information and error messages.
        observer - Used to handle notifications for server start and stop.
        Returns:
        The thread that was spawned to run the monitor.

      • runMonitorInternal

        private void runMonitorInternal​(Server server,
                                Logger logger,
                                ServerSocket serverSocket)
        Run the monitor listening for commands at serverSocket and sending them to the server.
        Parameters:
        server - The server being monitored.
        logger - Used to log error messages.
        serverSocket - The server socket on which the monitor is listening.

      • getCommand

        private String getCommand​(Socket clientSocket,
                          Logger logger)
                   throws IOException
        Read the key and command combination from the client socket connection.
        Parameters:
        clientSocket - The client socket connection.
        logger - Used to log error messages.
        Returns:
        The command that was read from the client socket connection or null if the key did not match.
        Throws:
        IOException - If there was an error reading from the client socket connection.

      • sendCommand

        public void sendCommand​(String command,
                        Logger logger)
        Send a command to the monitor.
        Parameters:
        command - The command.
        logger - Used to log error messages.

      • executeCommand

        private boolean executeCommand​(Server server,
                               String command,
                               Logger logger)
        Execute a command that was sent to the monitor.

        The following commands are supported:

        • configure name=value - Set the server property name to value
        • stop - Stop the server
        Parameters:
        server - The server.
        command - The command.
        logger - Used to log error messages.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether or not the monitor is should continue running.
        • true if the monitor should continue running
        • false if the monitor should stop

      • waitForStart

        private boolean waitForStart​(Server server,
                             Logger logger)
        Wait for the server to start.
        Parameters:
        server - The server being monitored.
        logger - Used to log error messages.
        Returns:
        true if the server has started.
        Since:
        2.1.0

      • waitForStop

        private boolean waitForStop​(Server server,
                            Logger logger)
        Wait for the server to stop.
        Parameters:
        server - The server being monitored.
        logger - Used to log error messages.
        Returns:
        true if the server has stopped.
        Since:
        2.1.0

      • bindMonitor

        private ServerSocket bindMonitor()
                          throws IOException
        Bind to the monitor first attempting to use InetAddress.getLocalHost() then falling back to using the loopback address if there is a security exception.
        Returns:
        The bound server socket.
        Throws:
        IOException - If there was a problem binding to the server socket.
        Since:
        2.1.2

      • connectMonitor

        private Socket connectMonitor()
                       throws IOException
        Connect to the monitor first attempting to use InetAddress.getLocalHost() then falling back to using the loopback address if there is a security exception.
        Returns:
        The connected socket.
        Throws:
        IOException - If there was a problem connecting to the socket.
        Since:
        2.1.2
